Key Arguments: The proposed legislation poses a greater threat to Australian life and freedom than misinformation itself.
Censorship and government control are more dangerous than misinformation.
Free speech should not be infringed upon in a democratic society.
Truth and propaganda can be managed through a vigorous media, social media, and education.
Personal responsibility should be emphasized by requiring individuals to attach their names to their online comments.
Main Themes: Role of media and education in combating misinformation
Notable Quotes: Misinformation and disinformation, what we used to call lies, does not, in my opinion, pose as large a threat to our Australian way of life, safety and wellbeing, as does the censorship and government control you propose.
Censorship of a person's free speech is an intolerable infringement on the rights of a citizen in a democratic Australia.
